notes: 54, "In this study, following local usage, 'peasant' does not imply that wage labor in agriculture or outside it is absent, that factors of production, such as land, labor, and capital, are not (in part) defined and treated as commodities, that production is not market-oriented, or that there exists some peasant community which is isolated from the larger society or internally homogenous culturally, socially, economically, or otherwise. That is to say, 'peasant' directs attention to the particular characteristics of cultural and socioeconomic units and relationships, which, in Dondon, no less than elsewhere in Haiti, are conceptualized and used in contrast or opposition to other culturally defined units and relationships."
